explanation:
OS_CHECK_POINTER — macro used with parameter var_id; its expansion must be inspected to ensure it does not perform an assignment to the parameter identifier (e.g. "var_id = ...") or otherwise rebind the pointer variable.

OS_CHECK_APINAME — macro used with parameter var_name; its expansion must be checked to ensure it does not modify the pointer parameter (reassign var_name) even though it may read the pointed-to object.

OS_ObjectIdAllocateNew — function called with var_name and &token; inspect implementation to ensure it does not modify the caller's parameter variables (it may modify the token or global state but must not assign to var_name or var_id).

OS_ObjectIdFinalizeNew — function called with &token and var_id; inspect to confirm it only writes through the pointer target (*var_id) (allowed) and does not attempt to reassign the caller's pointer variable (cannot in C unless macros are used). If it is a macro, its expansion must be checked.

OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET — macro used to fetch the table entry using token; inspect expansion to ensure it does not reference or reassign the function parameters (particularly var_id or var_name) by name.

OS_OBJECT_INIT — macro used with token, condvar and var_name; its expansion must be inspected because macros can contain assignments — ensure it does not reassign the parameter var_name or var_id.

OS_CondVarCreate_Impl — platform-specific implementation called from here; examine its prototype/implementation to ensure it cannot/does not rebind the caller's parameters (it is called with &token and options, but if macros or inline wrappers exist they could touch parameter identifiers).

OS_condvar_table — the object table referenced by OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET; inspect its accessor macros/definitions to ensure those macros do not reference or modify parameter identifiers.

osal_id_t — type of var_id; need its typedef to confirm whether any macros/functions operating on osal_id_t could use or modify the var_id identifier itself (and to validate what writing through var_id implies).

OS_object_token_t — type of token; included because many macros/functions operate on token and macros may reference parameter names; inspect related definitions to ensure no macro side-effects on parameters.

OS_condvar_internal_record_t — type of condvar used with OS_OBJECT_INIT/OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET; include to review any macros that initialize fields from var_name (allowed to copy into record) but ensure no macro rebinds the var_name parameter itself.
